intro: Gutierrezia petradoria, commonly known as desert gumweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its yellow flowers bloom in summer, and the plant has hairy, linear leaves that help reduce water loss. Gutierrezia petradoria is often found in disturbed soils and is used in restoration projects due to its hardy nature.
